Description:
Staff Management: Supervise, train, schedule, and evaluate housekeeping staff, including room attendants, janitors, and laundry personnel.
Cleaning and Maintenance: Oversee and participate in cleaning activities, ensuring rooms, public areas, and facilities are clean, well-maintained, and presentable.
Inventory Management: Maintain and manage inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment, ensuring adequate stock levels and efficient usage.
Quality Assurance: Inspect rooms and public areas to ensure they meet cleanliness and hygiene standards. Address any deficiencies or issues promptly.
Guest Satisfaction: Ensure guest satisfaction by promptly addressing requests and concerns related to housekeeping services.
Training: Conduct training sessions for housekeeping staff on cleaning procedures, safety protocols, and customer service standards.
Budgeting: Assist in budgeting and cost control efforts related to housekeeping operations.
Report Generation: Generate reports on housekeeping performance, including room occupancy and cleaning productivity.Skills
Skills:
Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in housekeeping in hotels or a related field, with some supervisory experience, is often required.
knowing how to deal with the cleaning heavy equipment is a must.
Leadership: Strong leadership and team management skills to effectively supervise and motivate housekeeping staff.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with staff and guests effectively.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure cleanliness and maintenance standards are met consistently.
Problem-Solving: Ability to address and resolve issues promptly, whether related to guest requests or staff performance.
Organizational Skills: Effective organization and time management skills to schedule staff and manage resources efficiently.
Customer Service: A customer-centric approach to ensure guest satisfaction and respond to their needs promptly.
Knowledge of Cleaning Procedures: Familiarity with cleaning techniques, equipment, and chemicals used in the industry.
